definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: in the passage the passenger passed a cassette of message to messenger.
sentences.chinese: 在过道里，搭客给信差传递了一盒带信息。

sentences.english: The letter was delivered by a courier this morning.
sentences.chinese: 送递急件的信差今天早晨送来了这封信。

sentences.english: One day when I was talking with the emperor, a messenger came to him.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，当我和皇帝交谈时，有位信差来晋见。

sentences.english: The passenger agrees to become a courier.
sentences.chinese: 这个乘客同意变成信差。

sentences.english: We send a information about messages of courier bye-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们借由电子邮件传送有关信差的消息。

sentences.english: The courier shook his head dubiously.
sentences.chinese: 这位信差疑惑地摇摇头。

sentences.english: In the passage the passenger passed a cassette of message to messenger.
sentences.chinese: 在过道里，搭客给信差通报了一盒带信息。

definition: to send word/to deliver a letter
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to send/to assign/to appoint/servants of an official/official messenger
official post/billet/commission/CL:件[jian4]/see also 差事[chai1 shi5]
intelligence gatherer/spy/detective/scout/sound (medical instrument)/long and narrow probing and sampling utensil
